item.title: Atleast a couple meters off un even road surface. Causing cyclists into traffic. Absolutely so dangerous., 19th February
item.description:
Pot holes have been here for as long as I can remember. Especially right opposite Halfords. A cyclists as already died just over a year ago that part of road as since been re surfaced. We can not wait for another fatality for action to be taken

item.title: Unsafe parking obstruction near junction – Thesiger Road SE20 7NQ, 18th February
item.description:
Vehicles are frequently parked very close to the junction on Thesiger Road, SE20 7NQ, causing an obstruction and narrowing the road to a single lane. This results in regular congestion, vehicles having to stop and wait for oncoming traffic, and reduced visibility for drivers turning into/out of the junction. The issue has been ongoing for a long time and occurs daily, particularly due to non-residents parking to visit nearby businesses. Some vehicles are left parked for several days without moving. This creates a significant road safety hazard for drivers and pedestrians. Please investigate and consider appropriate measures such as junction protection markings or double yellow lines to prevent obstruction and improve safety.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Thesiger Road, Penge, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Missing litter bin, 18th February
item.description:
The litter bin which has always been here is missing. People are now dumping rubbish where the bin was, and your staff are ignoring it. The dog waste bins were removed, so it's important to provide adequate bins. Please replace the bin.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Tynemouth Road, Plumstead
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Surface water pooling, 18th February
item.description:
A resident has asked that "...sort out the lake that appears in Perry street just down from the church by the field every time it rains!, It's been like it for 10 years!!" is fixed. I haven't seen this personally, just conveying information, albeit second hand. Apologies not to have first-hand information, nor photographs. Thank you.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Perry Street, Crayford, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Leaf and drainage neglect, 18th February
item.description:
On a yearly basis, I find myself clearing significant accumulation of leaves from the pavement and this year the drainage gully outside our property because it is left unattended for a very extended period. This year, the blockage has reached a point where drainage is impeded and making it difficult to exit from the car/road to the pavement.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Upper Elmers End Road, Elmers End, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Blue lidded bin has been dumped, 18th February
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Birchington Close, Barnehurst, Greater London

item.title: Burnt out car, 18th February
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Coleridge Walk, Temple Fortune, Greater London
